position.marginalia_text:
J.D. quid si s... Planus angulus est sup[er]fici[es] ad co[n]tactum duarum rectaru[m] mutuo se in plano tange[n]t[ium] et no[n] in directu[m] [deleted] extensar[um], posita. na[m] est [deleted] [deleted]. Anguli recti limi, a[e]qualiae sunt
Linea est semita puncti Linea est longitudo ex fluxu puncti effecta. Linea est puncti tract[ae] [etc] Linea est longitudo ex mutata puncti seda[e] Linea effecta est intervallu[m], quo [...] puncti motu[m] metimur Linea [intervallu[m] - deleted] est puncti Iter. A Linea est intervallu[m] quod punctu[m] movendu[m] descripsit Linea est duoru[m] punctoru[m] intervallum. Superficies est duar[um] linear[um] intervallum Corpus est duar[um] sup[er]ficior[um] intervallu[m]. D Linea recta est brevissu[m] duor[um] et eorundem punctor[um] intervallum B Superficies est intervallum quod linea motu suo (laterali no[n] indirectu[m] facto) efficit C Corpus est intervallum quod superficies ex motu suo in latus progignit.

marginalia.translation:
An plane angle is an area
Right angles are equal... A line is the path of a point. A line is a length established by the flow of a point. A line is ... A line is a length from ... An established line is the space by which we measure the movement of a point. A line is the way of a point. A A line is the space that a movable point marks. A line is the space between two points. An area is the space between two lines. A (geometric) body is the space between two areas. D A straight line is the shortest space between two and the same points. B An area is the space that a line establishes by its movement (not accomplished by a lateral movement) C A body is the space that an area produces from its movement to one side.
